title: South African cbank says no need for banks to use Big Four auditors
text:
May 3, 2018 / 9:29 AM / Updated 31 minutes ago South African cbank says no need for banks to use Big Four auditors Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
JOHANNESBURG, May 3 (Reuters) - South African central bank said on Thursday there was no requirement for a bank to use one of the Big Four auditing firms, hours after Barclays Africa said it has fired scandal-hit KPMG as its auditor.
Barclays decision raises further questions about the survival of the local unit of the global accountancy business. Reporting by Tiisetso Motsoeneng Editing by James Macharia
